de.feig.FEDM.Core

Class IPortGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.feig.FEDM.Core.IPortGroup

  • public class IPortGroup
extends java.lang.Object
    Internal class providing communication port specific commands.
    Description:
    This class realizes the nested interface with special methods for port specific commands for the Reader class ReaderModule.
    Methods of this class can be called with the IPort member of ReaderModule.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  IPortGroup.SerialPortSetting
      class for initializing the serial port with connectCOMM
      class  IPortGroup.TcpState
      class with all TCP connection states according RFC 793 (Transmission Control Protocol)

      • connectCOMM

        public void connectCOMM(int portNumber,
                        boolean withDetect,
                        IPortGroup.SerialPortSetting portPara)
                 throws FeException
        Opens a serial port and detects (optional) a reader.
        Parameters:
        portNumber - the number of the serial port in the range 1..256 (for Linux: 1 is asigned to ttyS0, 2 to ttyS1 and so on)
        withDetect - controls the internal detection with findBaudrate and call of ReadReaderInfo
        portPara - optional initialization parameters.
        If portPara is set to null, the following default values will be used: busAddress=0, baudRate=0, frame="8E1", charTimeoutMpy=1 and setRtsAndDtrOn=false.
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        Method opens a serial port and detects (optional, but recommended) a reader and reads information from reader.
        The optional detection should only be used if a reader is normally connected and powered on.
        After successful opening and (optional) initialization of the serial port, the reader will be detected with findBaudrate() method and if with success the complete reader information is read and can be queried with IInfoGroup.getReaderInfo().
        In case of not detecting a reader the serial port is closed again.
        The connect method can be used once for every reader object. If the port must be changed, the opened port must first be closed with the method disConnect.
        Important Note: After successful opening of the serial port and not detecting of the reader, the detection and the complete read of reader information must be done inside the user application.

      • connectCOMM

        public void connectCOMM(int portNumber,
                        IPortGroup.SerialPortSetting portPara,
                        int authentType,
                        java.lang.String authentKey)
                 throws FeException
        Opens a serial port and detects a reader (for secured data transmission).
        Parameters:
        portNumber - the number of the serial port in the range 1..256 (for Linux: 1 is asigned to ttyS0, 2 to ttyS1 and so on)
        portPara - optional initialization parameters.
        If portPara is set to null, the following default values will be used: busAddress=0, baudRate=0, frame="8E1", charTimeoutMpy=1 and setRtsAndDtrOn=false.
        authentType - authentication type (e.g. AES256)
        Authentication Type Value
        AES128 0
        AES192 1
        AES256 (recommended) 2
        authentKey - key as a hex formatted string
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        Method opens a serial port and detects a reader, starts a session for secured data transmission and reads information from reader.
        The Reader must be connected and powered on.
        After successful opening and (optional) initialization of the serial port, the reader will be detected with findBaudrate() method and if with success the complete reader information is read and can be queried with IInfoGroup.getReaderInfo().
        In case of not detecting a reader the serial port is closed again.
        The connect method can be used once for every reader object. If the port must be changed, the opened port must first be closed with the method disConnect.
        NOTE: After successful opening of the serial port and not detecting of the reader, the detection and the complete read of reader information must be done inside the user application.
        NOTE: Secured data transmission is not supported with every Reader. Please refer to the Reader's System Manual for additional information.
        If an internal error occurs, FeException is thrown with error code (<0).
        If an authentication error occurs, FeException is thrown with status code from Reader (>0).

      • connectBT

        public void connectBT(int portNumber)
               throws FeException
        Linux: Opens a Bluetooth port and detects (optional) a reader. Windows: Not recommended. Use connectCOMM
        Parameters:
        portNumber - the number of the Bluetooth port in the range 1..256 (1 is asigned to /dev/rfcomm0, 2 to /dev/rfcomm1 and so on)
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        This method is only for Linux!
        Method opens a Bluetooth port and detects a reader and reads information from reader.
        The Reader must be powered on.
        After successful opening of the Bluetooth port, the reader will be detected with findBaudrate() method and if with success the complete reader information is read and can be queried with IInfoGroup.getReaderInfo().
        In case of not detecting a reader the Bluetooth port is closed again.
        The connect method can be used once for every reader object. If the port must be changed, the opened port must first be closed with the method disConnect.

      • connectTCP

        public void connectTCP(java.lang.String host,
                       int portNumber)
                throws FeException
        Creates a Connection via TCP/IP to a server.
        Parameters:
        host - the address of the server (e.g. "192.168.1.1")
        portNumber - the ip port
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        Method creates a TCP/IP network connection and reads information from the reader.
        The port number should be used in ranges of 1024 and 65535.
        The connect method can be used once for every reader object. If the port must be changed, the opened port must first be closed with the method disConnect.
        After successful established connection, the reader information is read and is queried with IInfoGroup.getReaderInfo().

      • connectTCP

        public void connectTCP(java.lang.String host,
                       int portNumber,
                       int authentType,
                       java.lang.String authentKey)
                throws FeException
        Creates a Connection via TCP/IP to a server (for secured data transmission).
        Parameters:
        host - the address of the server (e.g. "192.168.1.1")
        portNumber - the ip port
        authentType - authentication type (e.g. AES256)
        Authentication Type Value
        AES128 0
        AES192 1
        AES256 (recommended) 2
        authentKey - key as a hex formatted string
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        Method creates a TCP/IP network connection, starts a session for secured data transmission and reads information from the reader.
        The port number should be used in ranges of 1024 and 65535.
        The connect method can be used once for every reader object. If the port must be changed, the opened port must first be closed with the method disConnect.
        After successful established connection, the reader information is read and is queried with IInfoGroup.getReaderInfo().
        NOTE: Secured data transmission is not supported with every Reader. Please refer to the Reader's System Manual for additional information.
        If an internal error occurs, FeException is thrown with error code (<0).
        If an authentication error occurs, FeException is thrown with status code from Reader (>0).

      • connectUSB

        public void connectUSB(long deviceID)
                throws FeException
        Creates a connection to a USB reader
        Parameters:
        deviceID - device identifier from Reader
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        Method creates a connection with an USB reader and reads information from the reader.
        If deviceID is 0 then the first scanned USB reader will be used. In this case, only one USB reader should be connected.
        If multiple USB readers are connected and must be handled at the same time, then the helper class FeUsb has methods implemented to scan the USB and to query the deviceIDs. The connect method can be used once for every reader object. If the port must be changed, the opened port must first be closed with the method disConnect.
        After successful established connection, the reader information is read and is queried with IInfoGroup.getReaderInfo().

      • connectUSB

        public void connectUSB(long deviceID,
                       int authentType,
                       java.lang.String authentKey)
                throws FeException
        Creates a connection to a USB reader (for secured data transmission)
        Parameters:
        deviceID - device identifier from Reader
        authentType - authentication type (e.g. AES256)
        Authentication Type Value
        AES128 0
        AES192 1
        AES256 (recommended) 2
        authentKey - key as a hex formatted string
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        Method creates a connection with an USB reader, starts a session for secured data transmission and reads information from the reader.
        If deviceID is 0 then the first scanned USB reader will be used. In this case, only one USB reader should be connected.
        If multiple USB readers are connected and must be handled at the same time, then the helper class FeUsb has methods implemented to scan the USB and to query the deviceIDs. The connect method can be used once for every reader object. If the port must be changed, the opened port must first be closed with the method disConnect.
        After successful established connection, the reader information is read and is queried with IInfoGroup.getReaderInfo().
        NOTE: Secured data transmission is not supported with every Reader. Please refer to the Reader's System Manual for additional information.
        If an internal error occurs, FeException is thrown with error code (<0).
        If an authentication error occurs, FeException is thrown with status code from Reader (>0).

      • disConnect

        public int disConnect()
               throws FeException
        This method disconnect the device and frees the allocated memory.
        Returns:
        0 if successful or (only for TCP/IP conections) >0 the last TCP state
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        Method disconnects a port which was previously opened with one of the three connect methods.
        For TCP/IP connections: if any problem while closing the socket occurs, the last TCP state is returned.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Returns the connection status.
        Returns:
        true if a device is connected
        Description:
        Method returns the connection status.
        This method can throw a de.feig.FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.

      • findBaudrate

        public int findBaudrate()
                 throws FeException
        Method to detect the baudrate and frame of a reader.
        Returns:
        status
        • 0 if OK
        • > 0 status byte of the responded protocol, if the Reader signals a problem. See Reader's System Manual for the full list with all status bytes
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        Detects the baudrate und protocol frame of the reader and adjusts the serial port.
        This method can only be used with the serial port driver.

      • readerAuthentication

        public int readerAuthentication(int authentType,
                                java.lang.String authentKey)
                         throws FeException
        Execute of Authentication process.
        Parameters:
        authentType - authentication type (e.g. AES256)
        Authentication Type Value
        TRANSMISSION_AES128 0
        TRANSMISSION_AES192 1
        TRANSMISSION_AES256 (recommended) 2
        authentKey - key as a hex formatted string
        Returns:
        status
        • 0 if OK
        • > 0 status byte of the responded protocol, if the Reader signals a problem. See Reader's System Manual for the full list with all status bytes
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        Starts a session with secured data transmission.
        The first secured session must be started with connectCOMM, connectUSB or connectTCP. After every authentication error, the restart of a session can be executed with this method.
        This method can be used with every communication port.
        NOTE: Secured data transmission is not supported with every Reader. Please refer to the Reader's System Manual for additional information.
        If an internal error occurs, FeException is thrown with error code (<0).
        If an authentication error occurs, FeException is thrown with status code from Reader (>0).

      • getTcpConnectionState

        public int getTcpConnectionState()
                          throws FeException
        Method to check the actual TCP/IP connection status.
        Returns:
        status
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)
        • > 0: the last TCP state
        • < 0: error code

        Description:
        When closing a TCP/IP connection, the last status of the connection is returned. If the status is not TIME_WAIT, getTcpConnectionState() should be called to observe the TCP/IP connection status, because a new connection to the same Reader is only possible after the connection state TIME_WAIT is reached.

      • setTimeout

        public void setTimeout(int timeout)
                throws FeException
        Setting communication timeout for Serial Port, USB, Bluetooth, LAN or WLAN.
        Parameters:
        timeout - new communication timeout in milliseconds
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

      • setPortPara

        public void setPortPara(java.lang.String parameter,
                        java.lang.String value)
                 throws FeException
        Sets a new parameter for the opened port.
        Parameters:
        parameter - a String object with the parameter id
        value - a String object with the parameter value
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        The following parameters are supported:
        Parameter ID Value range Default value Units Serial Port TCP/IP USB
        Baud 300...115200 38400 bits/s X - -
        Frame 8N1, 8E1, 8O1 8E1 - X - -
        Timeout 3000 0...99999 ms X X X
        TxTimeControl 0, 1 1 - X - -
        TxDelayTime 0...999 10 ms X - -
        CharTimeoutMpy 1...99 1 - X - -
        SetRTS On, Off Off - X - -
        SetDTR On, Off Off - X - -
        PortPrefix /dev/rfcomm /dev/ttyS - X
        only for Bluetooth with Linux
        this is a global parameter and must be
        set prior the use of connectCOMM
        		 - -

      • getPortPara

        public java.lang.String getPortPara(java.lang.String parameter)
                             throws FeException
        Query of a parameter from a port.
        Parameters:
        parameter - a String object with the parameter id
        Returns:
        a String object with the parameter value
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        The following parameters are supported: "Baud", "Frame", "Timeout", "TxTimeControl", "TxDelayTime", "CharTimeoutMpy"
        see also: setPortPara(String, String)

      • setProtocolFrameSupport

        public void setProtocolFrameSupport(int protocolFrame)
                             throws FeException
        Sets the protocol frame type
        Parameters:
        protocolFrame - contents the protocol frame type id
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        The protocol frame is normally set to be appropriate for the Reader with each connect method.
        The following parameters are supported: PROTOCOL_FRAME_STANDARD, PROTOCOL_FRAME_ADVANCED

      • getProtocolFrameSupport

        public int getProtocolFrameSupport()
                            throws FeException
        Query of the protocol frame type.
        Returns:
        an integer with the protocol frame type ID
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        The following values are returned: PROTOCOL_FRAME_STANDARD or PROTOCOL_FRAME_ADVANCED
        see also: setProtocolFrameSupport(int)

      • setBusAddress

        public void setBusAddress(byte busAddress)
        Sets the bus address of a reader connected on a serial port.
        Parameters:
        busAddress -
        Description:
        Method sets the bus address of a reader connected on a serial port.
        The default value is 255 and can be used, if only one reader is connected at the serial port.

        This method can throw a de.feig.FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.

      • getBusAddress

        public byte getBusAddress()
        Gets the bus address of a serial port reader.
        Returns:
        the bus address of a serial port reader
        Description:
        Method returns the bus address of a reader connected at a serial port.

        This method can throw a de.feig.FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.
